Name: George Washington
Trivia: Teeth were made from elephant and walrus tusks, not wood.

Name: John Adams
Trivia: First to live in the White House

Name: Thomas Jefferson
Trivia: Spoke 6 different languages

Name: James Madison
Trivia: Smallest President at 5' 4", under 100 lbs.

Name: James Monroe
Trivia: Died on the 4th of July, 1831, following both John Adams and Thomas Jefferson, who died on July 4, 1826

Name: John Quincy Adams
Trivia: Son of John Adams

Name: Andrew Jackson
Vice Presidents: John C. Calhoun & Martin Van Buren
Trivia: First President to ride in a train

Name: Martin Van Buren
Trivia: First President born an American citizen - (all before him were born in the British colonies)

Name: William Henry Harrison
Trivia: President for only 31 days, died of pnueumonia

Name: John Tyler
Trivia: Loved kids, had 15 children

Name: James K. Polk
Trivia: First President to serve a nation from coast to coast

Name: Zachary Taylor
Trivia: Never voted for a President

Name: Millard Fillmore
Trivia: First President to have a stove and running water in the White House

Name: Franklin Pierce
Trivia: Memorized his entire inaugural speech - 3,319 words

Name: James Buchanan
Trivia: Never married, his niece was White House hostess

Name: Abraham Lincoln
Trivia: Tallest President, First President to be assassinated

Name: Andrew Johnson
Trivia: Was buried wrapped in an American flag with a copy of the Constitution

Name: Ulysses S. Grant
Trivia: Was fined $20 for speeding with his horse and carriage

Name: Rutherford B. Hayes
Trivia: First President to use a phone - his phone number was 1

Name: James A. Garfield
Trivia: Could write with both hands at the same time - in different languages

Name: Chester A. Arthur
Trivia: Changed his pants several times a day - he owned 80 pairs of pants

Name: Grover Cleveland
Trivia: First and only President married in the White House

Name: Benjamin Harrison
Trivia: First President to have electric lights and a Christmas tree in the White House, grandson of William H. Harrison

Name: Grover Cleveland
Trivia: First and only President to ever serve 2 non-consecutive terms

Name: William McKinley
Trivia: First President to use campaign buttons

Name: Theodore Roosevelt
Trivia: Youngest person ever to be President

Name: William H. Taft
Trivia: Heaviest President - 332 pounds

Name: Woodrow Wilson
Trivia: Dreamed of being a stage performer

Name: Warren G. Harding
Trivia: Gambled away a set of White House china

Name: Calvin Coolidge
Trivia: Only President born on the 4th of July

Name: Herbert Hoover
Trivia: Spoke chinese to his wife to keep their stories private

Name: Franklin D. Roosevelt
Vice Presidents: John N. Garner & Henry A. Wallace & Harry S. Truman
Trivia: Only President to serve more than 2 terms

Name: Harry S. Truman
Trivia: Read every book in his hometown library

Name: Dwight D. Eisenhower
Trivia: Commander of Allied Forces during World War II

Name: John F. Kennedy
Trivia: Youngest elected President, first Catholic President

Name: Lyndon B. Johnson
Trivia: Was an auto mechanic and teacher before being President

Name: Richard M. Nixon
Trivia: Recommended a play to the Miami Dolphins in Super Bowl VI

Name: Gerald R. Ford
Trivia: Held his daughter's High School prom in the White House

Name: Jimmy Carter
Trivia: First President born in a hospital

Name: Ronald Reagan
Trivia: Oldest President (69-77)

Name: George Bush
Trivia: Survived 4 planes crashes during World War II

Name: William J. Clinton
Trivia: Played the saxophone on national TV

Name: George W. Bush
Trivia: Has a collection of over 250 signed baseballs

Name: Barack Obama
Trivia: The first African-American to become President - Go USA
